intro: Elsota hostmannii, commonly known as the hostmann's elmsota, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
